title: Perform virus scanning in MacOS Clamav
body:
I don't want to keep Clamav resident, but I would like to do a full scan periodically to ensure safety, so I'll show you how to do it.

## Environment

M1 Macbook Air

## Installation

Install using homebrew.

```bash
$ brew install clamav
```

## Update vulnerability/virus patterns

### Prepare configuration file

Use the one provided by default.

```bash
$ cp /opt/homebrew/etc/clamav/freshclam.conf.sample /opt/homebrew/etc/clamav/freshclam.conf
```

Eliminate the Example line from `/opt/homebrew/etc/clamav/freshclam.conf`.


### Vulnerability/virus pattern updates


```bash
$ freshclam
```

## Perform scan

Scan home directories.

```bash
$ calmscan ~/ --recursive --infected
```

`- - recursive`: recursively verify file contents.
`- - infected`: Limit output content to virus files only.

## Scan Results

```bash
----------- SCAN SUMMARY -----------
Known viruses: 8615816
Engine version: 0.105.0
Scanned directories: 96767
Scanned files: 574546
Infected files: 0
Total errors: 102
Data scanned: 33283.79 MB
Data read: 101097.09 MB (ratio 0.33:1)
Time: 2366.628 sec (39 m 26 s)
Start Date: 2022:05:08 10:42:33
End Date:   2022:05:08 11:22:00
```

## Routine execution

```bash
$ crontab -e
```

Pattern update/run home directory scan at midnight on Sunday

```bash
0 0 * * 0 freshclam && clamscan /Users/kemu/ --recursive --infected
```
